Articles.Content: Can someone explain this? I hope its some sort of awesomething.

A quick google search reveals this:

http://wiki.unity3d.com/index.php?title=XKCDColors

In May 2010, Randall Munroe of xkcd did an online survey asking people to name randomly selected colors from the RGB spectrum.

http://blog.xkcd.com/2010/05/03/color-survey-results/

The submissions were analyzed, averaged and turned into a list of color names. One developer called Rune Grimstad, compiled that list into a .NET class.

The following script is an adaptation of Rune Grimstad's class, to output Unity Color objects. There are 948 color constants in the XKCDColors class.

Unity adaptation by HarvesteR.

A quick google search reveals this:

http://wiki.unity3d.com/index.php?title=XKCDColors

That's pretty awesome. Thanks for the info!
It is very awesome. Made even more awesome by: "Unity adaptation by HarvesteR." (on the page linked above)
